declaration.content: Suppose the electric field in some region is found to be $$\bold{E} = kr^{3}\bold{\hat{r}}$$, in spherical coordinates ($$k$$ is some constant).

content.content: Find the total charge contained in a sphere of radius $$R$$, centered at the origin. Do this two ways.

content: Use Gauss's law – Gauss's law in differential form relates charge density, $$\rho$$, to the electric field, $$\bold{E}$$. We are given teh electric field so we can solve for the unknown charge density.

left_content.text: Definition of Gauss's Law in differential form
Substitute the given electric field into Gauss's Law
Compute the divergence of the electric field
In spherical coordinates, the divergence of a vector field, $$\bold{A}$$, is given by...

right_content.tex_string: \nabla \cdot \bold{A} = {1 \over r^2}{\partial \left( r^2 A_r \right) \over \partial r} + {1 \over r\sin\theta}{\partial \over \partial \theta} \left(  A_\theta\sin\theta \right) + {1 \over r\sin\theta}{\partial A_\varphi \over \partial \varphi}

left_content.text: Decompose the vector field into radial polar, and azimuthal components
Substitute the components of the electric field into the divergence formula, and compute

right_content.tex_string: \begin{aligned}\nabla \cdot \bold{E} &= {1 \over r^2}{{\partial \over \partial r}\left(r^{2}\cdot kr^{3}\right)} + {1 \over r\sin\theta}{\partial \over \partial \theta} \left(  0 \cdot \sin\theta \right) + {1 \over r\sin\theta}{{\partial \over \partial \varphi}\left(0\right)}  \\ \\ &= {1 \over r^2}{{\partial \over \partial r}\left(kr^{5}\right)}\\ \\ &= {1 \over r^{2}}\left(5kr^{4}\right)\\ \\ \nabla \cdot \bold{E} &= 5kr^{2} \end{aligned}

left_content.text: Substitute the computed divergence back into Gauss's Law
Final form of the charge density

solution.accordion_title: Find the total charge contained in a sphere of radius $$R$$, centered at the origin. Do this two ways.

content: We can integrate the charge density over the volume of the sphere. We may also use the integral form of Gauss's Law to find the same information
